subtask_1_output.label: A
subtask_1_output.title: Slow Evaporation of Tap Water
subtask_1_output.summary: Tap water (1-2 L) was evaporated in a shallow black bowl at room temperature on a windowsill to enrich heavier water isotopes.

subtask_1_output.label: B
subtask_1_output.title: Microwave Boiling of Enriched Water
subtask_1_output.summary: Enriched water (20-50 mL) was briefly boiled in a microwave to sterilize and kill accumulated bacteria.

subtask_1_output.label: C
subtask_1_output.title: Filtration of Enriched Water
subtask_1_output.summary: Enriched water (~500 mL) was filtered through fluted filter paper to remove particulate matter before distillation.

subtask_1_output.label: D
subtask_1_output.title: Fractional Distillation of Enriched Water
subtask_1_output.summary: Filtered enriched water was fractionally distilled using a round-bottom flask and condensers to further enrich H2^17O.
references: Supporting Information Figure S1, p. S-9

subtask_1_output.label: E
subtask_1_output.title: Electrolysis of Enriched Water
subtask_1_output.summary: H2^17O was electrolyzed in a phosphate buffer with KCl using copper cathode and graphite anode to generate ^17O-labeled hydrogen peroxide.

subtask_1_output.label: F
subtask_1_output.title: Colorimetric Quantification of Hydrogen Peroxide
subtask_1_output.summary: ^17O-Labeled hydrogen peroxide was quantified using two colorimetric assays based on redox reactions.
references: Supporting Information, Quantitation of H2O2 by two methods, p. S-8

subtask_1_output.label: G
subtask_1_output.title: 17O NMR Spectroscopy of Water
subtask_1_output.summary: 17O NMR spectra of enriched water samples at pH 6.6 and 2.6 were acquired using a spectrometer with a coaxial capillary and CDCl3 lock to verify enrichment.

subtask_1_output.label: H
subtask_1_output.title: Synthesis of 17O-Labeled 1-Hexanol
subtask_1_output.summary: 17O-Labeled 1-hexanol was synthesized by reacting 17O-enriched water with sodium metal followed by 1-iodohexane in acetone.

subtask_1_output.label: I
subtask_1_output.title: GC-MS Analysis of 1-Hexanol
subtask_1_output.summary: GC-MS was used to analyze 1-hexanol to determine the percentage of 17O enrichment, using trimethylsilyl ether derivatives for enhanced detection.

subtask_1_output.label: J
subtask_1_output.title: Preparation of Trimethylsilyl Ether of 1-Hexanol
subtask_1_output.summary: Trimethylsilyl ether of 1-hexanol was prepared by reacting 1-hexanol with bis(trimethylsilyl)trifluoroacetamide (BSTFA).

subtask_1_output.label: K
subtask_1_output.title: Synthesis of 17O-Labeled Hexamethyldisiloxane (HMDS)
subtask_1_output.summary: 17O-Labeled HMDS was prepared by reacting 17O-enriched water with bis(trimethylsilyl)trifluoroacetamide (BSTFA).

subtask_1_output.label: L
subtask_1_output.title: GC-MS Analysis of Hexamethyldisiloxane (HMDS)
subtask_1_output.summary: GC-MS in SIS mode was used to analyze HMDS to determine the percentage of 17O enrichment by monitoring m/z 135-150 amu.

subtask_1_output.label: M
subtask_1_output.title: 17O NMR Spectroscopy of Sodium Hydroxide, Hexanol, HMDS, Trimethylsilanol, and Trifluoroacetamide
subtask_1_output.summary: 17O NMR spectra were acquired for labeled sodium hydroxide, 1-hexanol, trimethylsilanol, hexamethyldisiloxane, and trifluoroacetamide to characterize their 17O chemical shifts.

subtask_1_output.label: N
subtask_1_output.title: Preparation of 17O-Labeled Camphor
subtask_1_output.summary: 17O-Labeled camphor was prepared by exchanging the ketone oxygen of camphor with 17O-enriched water in CDCl3.

subtask_1_output.label: O
subtask_1_output.title: 17O NMR Spectroscopy of Camphor
subtask_1_output.summary: 17O NMR spectra of labeled camphor in CDCl3 were acquired to determine the 17O chemical shift.

subtask_1_output.label: P
subtask_1_output.title: 1H and 13C NMR Spectroscopy of Labeled Compounds
subtask_1_output.summary: 1H and 13C NMR spectra were acquired for 17O-labeled 1-hexanol, camphor, trimethylsilanol and hexamethyldisiloxane to characterize their structure and isotopic effects.

subtask_1_output.label: Q
subtask_1_output.title: Study of Oxygen Exchange Reaction with Camphor and Ethanol
subtask_1_output.summary: The oxygen exchange reaction of camphor in ethanol with 17O-enriched water was studied using 17O NMR to observe ethanol labeling.
references: Main text, Results and Discussion, p. 235

subtask_1_output.label: R
subtask_1_output.title: Study of Oxygen Exchange Reaction with Cyclohexanone and Ethanol
subtask_1_output.summary: The oxygen exchange reaction of cyclohexanone in ethanol with 17O-enriched water was studied using 17O NMR and compared with camphor.
references: Main text, Results and Discussion, p. 235

subtask_1_output.label: S
subtask_1_output.title: Study of Alcohol Exchange Reaction with Camphor and Hexanol
subtask_1_output.summary: The exchange reaction of camphor dissolved in hexanol with 17O-enriched water was studied using 17O NMR to determine the mechanism of alcohol exchange.
references: Main text, Results and Discussion, p. 236

subtask_1_output.label: T
subtask_1_output.title: GC-MS Retention Time Analysis for Isotope Fractionation
subtask_1_output.summary: GC-MS was used to analyze the retention times of labeled and unlabeled 1-hexanol and HMDS to study isotope fractionation effects.
references: Main text, Results and Discussion, p. 237

subtask_1_output.label: U
subtask_1_output.title: MS-MS Fragmentation Analysis of Hexanol and Camphor
subtask_1_output.summary: MS-MS fragmentation analysis was performed on labeled and non-labeled hexanol and camphor to investigate structural differences and fragmentation patterns.
references: Main text, Results and Discussion, p. 238

subtask_1_output.label: V
subtask_1_output.title: Density Measurement of Water
subtask_1_output.summary: Density of deionized water and H2^17O fraction were measured at 21oC using a calibrated pipettor and balance.
references: Main text, Results and Discussion, p. 233
Supporting Information, Experimental details, p. S-3

subtask_1_output.label: W
subtask_1_output.title: Refractive Index Measurement of Water
subtask_1_output.summary: Refractive index of deionized water and H2^17O fraction were measured at 21oC using a refractometer.
references: Main text, Results and Discussion, p. 233
Supporting Information, Experimental details, p. S-3
